command: $d = (Get-DnsClientCache).Name | Where-Object { $_ -match '\.' } | Select-Object -Unique | Get-Random; $cf = Invoke-WebRequest -UseBasicParsing -Headers @{accept='application/dns-json'} "https://cloudflare-dns.com/dns-query?name=$d&type=A" -TimeoutSec 5; $gd = Invoke-WebRequest -UseBasicParsing -Headers @{accept='application/dns-json'} "https://dns.google/resolve?name=$d&type=A" -TimeoutSec 5; $ips1 = ((($cf.Content | ConvertFrom-Json).Answer).data) -join ','; $ips2 = ((($gd.Content | ConvertFrom-Json).Answer).data) -join ','; if ($ips1 -ne $ips2) { Invoke-WebRequest -UseBasicParsing -Method POST -ContentType 'application/json' -Body (@{domain=$d; cloudflare=$ips1; google=$ips2; ts=(Get-Date).ToUniversalTime().ToString('o')} | ConvertTo-Json) 'https://siem.example.local/api/ingest/dns-anomaly' }
explanation: Defensive cross-validation for T1568: compares DNS-over-HTTPS answers from multiple resolvers for a cached domain to spot resolution manipulation characteristic of dynamic resolution techniques.
rationale_steps: Pick a random domain from DNS client cache.
Query two independent DoH resolvers for A records.
Compare returned IP sets and flag mismatches.
Report anomalies to SIEM via Invoke-WebRequest.
